title: Barry White - Collector's Edition 3CD (2007) Flac-Cue
description:
Barry White, born Barry Eugene Carter (September 12, 1944 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ July 4, 2003), was an American composer and singer-songwriter.
A two-time Grammy Award-winner known for his distinctive bass voice and romantic image, White's greatest success came in the 1970s
 as a solo singer and with the Love Unlimited Orchestra, crafting many enduring soul, funk, and disco songs such as his two 
biggest hits, "You're the First, the Last, My Everything" and "Can't Get Enough of Your Love, Babe." Along with Isaac Hayes,
 White is considered by Allmusic.com as a pioneer of disco music in the early 1970s.
During the course of his career in the music business, White achieved 106 gold albums worldwide, 41 of which also attained
 platinum status. White had 20 gold and 10 platinum singles, with worldwide sales in excess of 100 million, according to 
critics Ed Hogan and Wade Kergan.His influences included Rev. James Cleveland, Ray Charles, Aretha Franklin plus Motown artists
 The Supremes, The Four Tops and Marvin Gaye.
